results.title: Countering sexism
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A compilation tape of four programmes addressing various aspects of sex discrimination. The episodes highlight women working in the media, the importance of gender inclusive curriculum, girls and science and sexual harrassment in schools.

results.title: Correlieu (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Louis Portugais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The life and philosophy of the Quebec painter, Ozias Leduc, traced through his own paintings and scenes of his home, “Correlieu”, and the surrounding countryside. His technique and its influence on other painters is demonstrated, and his consciousness of the turbulent modern schools that came and went during his long lifetime is revealed. Included are some of the large paintings he did for cathedrals and churches. Narrated by George Whalley.

results.title: Cost, profit & break-even (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese is joined by John Bird who explains to him why his factory which produces coupled cutlery has gone bankrupt. The film is designed to show the influence of the cost of a product on its price and how the volume produced affects that cost. Also considers how productivity is the only way to increase wages without increasing inflation. Intended for line managers, senior executives and personnel not directly concerned with finance. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Continental drift
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exposition through film animation of the theory that Earth’s land areas are fluid and that, in the process of a slow, rolling, boiling motion, one part of the Earth might well be engulfed and then rise again some distance away, much the same as froth on a kettle of soup. From this theory comes the idea that continents were formed from one super-continent that broke up, whose pieces sank, and then rose once more, but far apart. Introducing the film is Professor J. Tuzo Wilson, geophysicist, University of Toronto. Animation by Co Hoedeman. (Award: London.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Co Hoedeman, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Continent in crisis
results.creator_credit: David Smith, Malcolm Paterson and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The Australian environment is in severe ecological crisis with soil degradation, salinity and deforestation all taking their toll on the land. But it is not all doom and gloom. Through satellite technology using remote sensing and computer analysis, scientists are able to plot the landscape on a daily, even hourly, basis and chart such occurrences as bushfires, floods, vegetation regrowth etc. This allows for future planning both environmentally and economically. “Continent in crisis” is a celebration of Australia’s natural beauty from the red centre, to the rainforests to the Great Barrier Reef and of the world-ranking environmental research being undertaken by CSIRO and others.

results.title: Cosmic zoom
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Probes the infinite magnitude of space, and its reverse, the ultimate minuteness of matter. Animation art and animation camera achieve this journey to the farthest conceivable point of the universe and then into the tiniest particle of existence - an atom of a living cell - with freshness and clarity that would seem impossible with other means of exposition. (Awards: Bilbao, Buenos Aires, Philadelphia, Berlin)

results.title: Cosmic rays
results.creator_credit: Hugh Odishaw, Stanley Ruttenberg, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Deals with the radiations observed on earth and first identified early in this century as a phenomenon originating in outer space. Current concepts of their origin are presented and their study related to other fields of scientific research, such as atomic and nuclear physics.

results.title: Bilingualism
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A close view of a wide-open management’s handling of a problem with parallels far beyond the borders of Quebec. How Steinberg Ltd comes to grips with one of the major challenges it faces - the bilingual, bicultural nature of the Quebec society in which it functions - is seen, as top and middle management pursue a policy on the issues. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Growth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A hand-cart and bicycle, then a delivery wagon and a horse - Sam Steinberg reminisces over the fifty years of his company’s growth into a large, diversified corporation. A company cannot stand still, it must go forward he claims. In this film you see the process continuing as corporation executives meet to consider interrelated operations, projects and priorities. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.
